• 10 Month Contract + 2 x 12 Month optional extensions
• Rates Negotiable (Market Value)
• Brisbane CBD + Caseldine Location with a 2-3 days per week WFH flexibility

Hudson is working with a large dynamic and innovative organisation in search of a Data Analyst to enhance the decision making processed and drive business success.

You will play a crucial role in supporting the team to enhance data quality, define data sources, build dashboards, and perform analytics. Your responsibilities will include analyzing data from the existing system, collaborating with vendors, and designing data migration processes. You will work closely with stakeholders to provide valuable insights and recommendations, contributing to informed business decisions.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Analyze data from the existing system to determine volumes for migration to the new application and identify data quality issues.
• Liaise with vendors to map existing data to the requirements of the new system, utilizing templates for staging entities.
• Utilize data warehousing and Power BI for effective data management and visualization.
• Design and execute data migration processes, including the remediation of low-quality data, extract jobs, transformation processes, and migration audit logs.
• Demonstrate proficiency with ETL/ELT tools to extract, transform, and load data from multiple sources into templates provided by the vendor of the new system.
• Collaborate with the Lead Analyst to manage technical risks, issues, conflicts, and priorities, ensuring timely project completion.

QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS
• Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics).
• Proven experience in data analysis, data migration, and data interpretation.
• Familiarity with data warehousing and Power BI.
• Hands-on experience with ETL/ELT tools and the ability to work with multiple data sources.
• Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
• Problem-solving mindset and the ability to manage technical risks and challenges.
• Attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring high data quality.

To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link below. Alternatively, please contact Harme Son through email on harme.son@hudson.com to discuss further.

Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

Job Description & Summary

Genuine opportunities can be hard to spot. Unless you're someone who's used to finding needles in haystacks made of data. If you're one of those people, you also probably know that opportunities this good don't come along that often.

PwC is one of those places where opportunities create options.

We're a community of people united by the love of solving problems, and every solution we deliver cements trust with our clients.
And that trust creates more opportunities to strengthen our relationships and fortify our culture.

More than just a number

Supportive team leaders elevate your success.

We lead differently, empowering our people to harness their human ingenuity, passion and latest technology to create a better tomorrow.
We empower our people to use their creativity, authenticity and human differences to be the champions of change.

We know that when people from a variety of backgrounds and with different points of view work together, we create the most value - for our clients, our people and our society.
In Data Assurance, we care deeply about our people and the numbers. We celebrate having a culture where innovation meets passion. For us, it's about having an incredible team to solve important problems.

Feel confident in Assurance

What is assurance? A feeling of confidence.

It's what we strive to deliver to our clients as we work side by side to help solve the myriad of issues they face.
This assurance, in turn, enables organisations to build and earn trust with their stakeholders.

Data has changed the world. Our clients need trusted advice on how to best gather, use and analyse their information. That's where we come in.

We offer a wide range of services, from data governance and data quality to large scale recalculation, visualisation, data collection and validation platforms, as well as advanced analytics.
Our Data Assurance team works alongside clients in a multitude of ways. These may be complex recalculations of business process outcomes, developing bespoke solutions to specific problems.

We help transform external and internal audit approaches by embedding data analytics through the entire audit lifecycle and look to the future as algorithmic decisioning becomes embedded in operational areas.

We also help our clients establish the best controls, processes and structures to ensure that decisions are made on accurate information.

We often assure that information and data provided to regulators and third parties is accurate, complete and can be trusted.
About you

You have a background in data analytics. You're skilled in data visualisation, data cleansing and manipulation, and you understand business and risk applications. If you have any previous experience in internal audit analytics, that's a big green flag for us

As a Senior Associate in our Data Assurance team, you'll make an impact through:

Building risk and compliance data analytics outputs using tools like Alteryx, ACL, R, Python, Qlik Sense, Power BI, and SQL Server.

Applying risk and compliance analytics to drive decision making for our clients, helping them to better manage risks, optimise processes and build trust with their stakeholders.

Working across multiple client projects, with a broad range of tasks across the data analytics life cycle, like ETL, data wrangling and cleansing, reporting and dashboarding.
Compelling data-driven storytelling to communicate and help clients minimise risk and improve their processes and control framework.

Your New Benefits

Flexible daily working hours, we value work-life balance

Work overseas or interstate, we know how precious time is with your family and friends

Paid study (and leave), we pay all the costs and give you time off to study

No dress code, wear what makes you feel comfortable and dress for your day

Yearly bonuses, because who doesn't love to be rewarded for great performance

Health & fitness perks, like a wellness stipend and discounted memberships

Generous parental leave policy for mums, dads and foster carers

If you're looking for a team that values your work and solves meaningful problems, apply now

We believe the best work is human-led and tech-powered.

If you're keen to apply and need reasonable adjustments or would like to note which pronouns you use at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.
Maricruz Yangali is the Recruitment Manager for the role.

As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

We are inviting applications for a 6-month contract opportunity in our People & Culture Workforce Information team as Data Analyst - HRIS.

Make a meaningful difference with us

The position of the Data Analyst, Workforce Information would be to support the Data Migration Lead and the wider Workforce Information team with the development and management workforce analytics and reporting obligations.

To do well in this role, an eye for detail, an understanding of popular data analysis tools, systems and databases, and a strong willingness to gain experience as a data analyst is essential.

Please note, this is a 6 month, maximum term contract opportunity.

Your part in our UnitingCare team

You will focus on:
• Design complex SQL queries for workforce information and reporting
• Design and management of the reporting environment (Power BI), including data sources, security, and metadata.
• Troubleshooting the workforce analytics and reporting environments.
• Change control and script updates for revised reporting requirements.
• Develop and implement data collections, data analytics and other strategies that optimise analytic performance, efficiency and quality.
• Provision of quality assurance, data integrity and normalisation of imported data.
• Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
• Identification and definition of new process improvement and analytic opportunities.

Undertake other duties as required/directed as service needs change or grow, consistent with the above and within the scope of the position and any other legal or industrial obligations.

What makes a difference for us?

The successful candidate will ideally demonstrate the following:

Work experience as a data analyst or in a related field
• Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent.
• Experience with Power BI, Excel and other relevant reporting tools.
• Experience with SQL, Python and MS Power Platform.
• Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks within the data or process.
• Ability to translate business requirements into technical and functional specifications.
• Knowledge of:
• Queries and Databases structures (SQL).
• Office Applications (Advanced Excel, Word, Outlook)
• Dashboarding Tools (Power Bi)
• Analytic Tools and Programming (Python, DAX)
• Data Structures (DB Tables, Flat files, CSV, Excel, JSON, etc.)
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills, alongside high-level presentation skills – including an ability to clearly communicate complex ideas in a way that is easy to understand.
• Robust record-keeping practices.

Desirable skills
• Previous exposure to high volume workforce analytics highly regarded but not essential.
• Experience with:
• Queries and Databases structures (SQL).
• Workday
• Office Applications (Advanced Excel, Word, Outlook)
• Dashboarding Tools (Power Bi)
• Analytic Tools and Programming (ACL, Python, DAX)
• Data Structures (DB Tables, Flat files, CSV, Excel, JSON, etc.)

We'd love you to be part of our UnitingCare family

For more than 100 years we've been inspired by our mission to improve the health and wellbeing of individuals, families and communities. The second-largest Queensland employer, we're a proud not-for-profit with more than 16,500 staff and 9,000 volunteers across our brands of BlueCare, Lifeline, ARRCS, The Wesley Hospital, Buderim Private Hospital, St Stephen's Hospital, and St Andrew's War Memorial Hospital. Our team are compassionate, inclusive and committed to the work we do, helping people live life in all its fullness.

Start making a difference today

Our application process takes less than 15 minutes – Click the 'APPLY' button to be taken to our online application process and upload your resume and cover letter. Our team are available to answer any questions you may have.

Working closely with the Manager, Business Intelligence and Customer Reporting (BICR), the Principal Data Analyst is responsible for leading the maintenance, development and implementation of various business intelligence and performance reporting methods and systems. These data sets and products should be designed to monitor and project performance data pertaining to the topics of employment, small business and vocational education and training (VET). As a senior member of the team, you will demonstrate a high skill set in contemporary technologies for data collection, data management and data analysis. Your involvement will extend to collaborating with and coaching fellow team members and clients at varying levels across the department to deliver data processing, business intelligence and reporting products that support the strategic direction of DYJESBT.

As The Principal Data Analyst, You Will Specifically
• Provide high-level strategic advice to senior management, other work units and stakeholders on matters related to data collection, data management and data analysis.
• Lead the processing, extraction, analysis, and presentation of internal and external organisational data in a cloud-based environment.
• Responsible for prioritising business requirements in conjunction with the leadership team of Data and Analytics.
• Develop and implement innovative cloud-based business intelligence solutions to present departmental data and statistics in an accessible and user-friendly manner for distribution to internal and external customers.
• Identify and implement best practice procedures to ensure that data processing and reporting output is relevant, replicable and that quality standards and timelines are met.
• Supervise and coordinate the activities of team members undertaking the processing, extraction, analysis and reporting of organisational data.
• Lead the data governance activities of Data and Analytics by reviewing, evaluating, documenting, and updating processes and methodologies used in the maintenance and reporting of organisational data.
• Draft briefing notes, Ministerial and executive management correspondence on a range of complex and sensitive issues.

We're committed to appointing the best-suited person for each role. This includes considering equity, diversity, respect, and inclusion needs within our agency.

We believe that these elements are essential for the success of our team, and we strongly encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply.

Data Analyst - Retail Analytics

Req ID: 50226

Department: AR Migration

Division: Australia Retail

Location: Melbourne/Brisbane

About the role

Data Analyst - Retail Analytics (Customer Migration)

Role Location: Melbourne/Brisbane

Role Type: Permanent Full Time

At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We’re making this happen by improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our customers so they can achieve incredible things– whether they’re buying a home, building a business or saving for things big or small.

This Data Analyst role is part of Retail Analytics and sits in our Initiatives – Migration squad where our mission is to help customers achieve their goals by migrating them to products that better support the ways they save, use and manage their money, pay and get paid. We use design excellence to reimagine processes and iterate capabilities that will support customer migration.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the overall delivery of the team's goals and priorities. You will manage pieces of work, develop data driven insights and reports that will enhance and support the objectives of the Customer Migration Portfolio.

As a Data Analyst, you deeply understand the power of data to generate quality customer insight, manage information, identify trends and make decisions. You will consult with stakeholders to understand business problems and collaborate with other data practitioners to design and deliver appropriate solutions.

What will your day look like
• Address and solve complex business issues using large amounts of data
• Source data from a variety of sources to combine, synthesise and analyse to generate insights
• Continuous generation, monitoring, presenting and conducting of 'fact-based' analysis of relevant customer insights to use at any time for the development and improvement of relevant and innovative propositions
• Generate, monitor, present and analyse relevant customer insights, costs, benefits, and risks for customers, clients and cohort products; this could include business casing, what if scenarios and opportunity sizing & assessments

What will you bring?

We know not everyone will bring all of the skills and experience, and at ANZ we are focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Some of the skills we are looking for are below, but don’t worry if you don’t have all of these as learning on the job is the way we work.
But back to some of the skills
• To grow and be successful in the role, you will ideally bring the following:
• Analytical and inquisitive mindset to continuously improve the level of insight surfaced
• Ability to translate data insights into practical business recommendations
• Strong communication and presentation skills
• Proficiency in SQL for handling large complex datasets of varying types
• Strong understanding of the data and analytics lifecycle i.e. exploratory data analysis, data modelling and design, data wrangling, data quality, hypothesis testing, data visualisation and dashboard design.
• Ability to effectively communicate to stakeholders (technical and non-technical)
• Experience with tools/systems such as GitHub, JIRA, Confluence, QlikSense and SQL databases.

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.

So, why join us?

There’s something special about being part of ANZ. From the moment you join us, you’re part of a team working towards a common goal: improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers.

But it’s not just our customers who’ll feel your impact. You’ll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you’ll have the resources and community you need to take the next big step in your career, towards even bigger things in the future.

We offer a range of benefits tailored to the countries in which we operate including Health and Wellbeing programs and flexible working arrangements.

You’ll also enjoy working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.careers.anz.com. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and searching for reference number 50226

About the Company:

Major Australian not-for profit, looking for a Senior Data Analyst to support the business through a Government Reform project with data analysis, calculations, complex modelling, insights and advice. You will be responsible for gathering, analysing, and interpreting data from various sources, and utilising advanced statistical and analytical methods to uncover valuable insights and create solutions that support business objectives.

About the Role:

As a Senior Data Analyst, initially you role will focus on providing support for the Government Reform project, through developing complex financial and operational models to help determine the implications of the reform on the business, and to inform strategic decision making. In the long term, your role will transition to providing complex analysis and insights to solve various business problems, including delving into blue sky problems.

Key Responsibilities:
• Collect, analyse and interpret data from various sources, using advanced statistical and analytical methods
• Develop and implement data analysis systems and applications, using tools such as SQL, Python, R, PowerBI
• Provide specialist data analysis skills to uncover insights and develop solutions to support business goals
• Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders and senior management, using clear and compelling visualisations and reports
• Apply mathematical, statistical, and other advanced analytical techniques to solve complex business problems and generate actionable insights.
• Create dashboards, reports, presentations, and other deliverables to communicate analysis results and recommendations to stakeholders and senior management
About You:
• 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, ideally in a large business or Government
• Proficient in SQL and at least one programming language such as Python or R
• Experience in financial modelling, predictive analytics, and complex business models
• Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills

Our Business

Brisbane City Council is one of the largest local governments in the Asia-Pacific region and one of the biggest employers in Queensland. We have more than 300 job types across a broad range of service areas, with roles that serve our community. We employ an inclusive and diverse workforce, with great benefits and flexible work options. A job with us offers skill development, career mobility and access to benefits that matter.

Our Branch

Transport Planning and Operations (TPO) is all about keeping Brisbane moving – whether it’s our road network or cycling along one of our many bikeways and shared pathways.

Responsible for the outcomes relating to Transport for Brisbane (Program 1) and Infrastructure for Brisbane (Program 2), TPO plays a lead role in planning and maintaining Council's transport network and implementing the Transport Plan for Brisbane to enable the efficient and sustainable movement of people and freight.

The Role

This is a newly created function in the Business Improvement and Data team and will provide a consolidated and collaborative approach across a diverse range of complex data requirements. The primary purpose of this role is to develop and maintain data modelling and design that supports the data analytics and enhance data quality. You will undertake analysis of data; identify, verify and investigate significant information that will assist towards the strategic direction of Transport Planning and Operations.

If you love data and are well experience in presenting a strategic dashboard in Power BI along with being customer centric, then this is your role.

To be successful you will have:
• extensive experience building and maintaining complex data models for reporting purposes and building complex measures and calculations in tools including Power BI, Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics
• demonstrated experience using data visualisation software to tell a story through data and ensure stakeholder engagement and interest
• extensive experience in writing data queries using query languages such as SQL and Power Query M
• strategic thinking, analytical, research and problem-solving skills, including the ability to synthesise and summarise complex material, identify opportunities and develop recommendations to maintain best-practice data insights analysis
• strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to effectively liaise with internal and external stakeholders.

Benefits of working for Council include:

About the role:

The Tertiary Skills and Pathways team is responsible for the unit mapping project, as part of its program of work. Unit mapping uses natural language processing techniques to create a connection between tertiary education learning materials (VET and HE units), and skills taxonomies. Unit mapping helps to identify skills taught in tertiary education, and their potential relationship to occupations and the labour market, to assist in analysis and advice on tertiary education delivery.

The team is working on a demonstration project basis with five key projects to design the end to end process of unit mapping, to continually refine the data science model, and to generate insights on the potential use of mapping outputs. The outputs of models are large, for example one university with approximately 3,000 units can have an output of approximately 30,000 skills mapped. Validation of outputs is a critical part of the mapping process to produce a model and results that are highly accurate.

Duties:
• Developing of a comprehensive internal and external validation process for very large data sets, to support improvement of data science models, and the quality of output data sent to partners. This may require an ensemble of approaches, for example statistical sampling, manual and automated approaches to validation.
• Managing internal validation processes before outputs are sent to project partners.
• Working closely with the data science team to provide feedback for the mapping model development.
• Analysing complex model outputs, to derive valuable insights for reporting to project partners, including visualisation techniques.
• Providing advice to technical services on interface design for a validation application for project partners.

Required experience/skills:
• Demonstrated experience in data analysis and process design, to create replicable data validation processes to improve data output quality.
• Excellent analytical skills, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to synthesise and critically analyse large volumes of structured and unstructured data.
• Strong skills and experience in data management, in particular how data can be effectively structured, analysed, presented and communicated, to achieve high-quality outcomes.
• Excellent communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate key data insights visually and in written form to a range of diverse stakeholders
• Well-developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting.

Desirable experience skills:
• Experience in R Shiny, Python, SQL, anduser experience design.
• Understanding of, and experience working with tertiary education (HE and/or VET) and/or occupation and labour market data.
• Understanding and experience in data science, or related fields.
• Experience operating in a policy environment.

Job Title: Business Analyst

Location: Brisbane, Sydney, or Melbourne. Hybrid working arrangements.

Location: Ideally Brisbane (Open to Sydney or Melbourne)

Work Arrangements: Hybrid Working Arrangements.

An ambitious and rapidly growing organization, is on a transformative journey to reshape its workforce planning, talent management, and payroll processes, among other core people systems. We are looking for highly skilled and experienced Business Analyst to join their Program Team and play a pivotal role in this large-scale program of work.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Process Analysis:
• Facilitate workshops to understand and document current "as-is" processes across various business functions.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to identify pain points and areas for improvement.

2. Systems Mastery:
• Quickly become an expert in new applications and systems, understanding their capabilities and functionalities.
• Translate this expertise into recommendations for business process enhancements.

3. Business-Technology Interface:
• Serve as a bridge between business functions, technology teams, and support teams, ensuring seamless communication and alignment.

4. Data Analysis and Documentation:
• Document and analyze the information and data required to support the transformation program.
• Create comprehensive documentation, including quick reference guides and training materials.

5. Stakeholder Collaboration:
• Work closely with the business to recommend "to-be" processes that leverage the efficiencies offered by the new systems.
• Challenge the status quo and drive conversations to clarify project outcomes.

6. Training and User Support:
• Develop training documentation and quick reference guides.
• Provide training to new users to ensure a smooth transition to the new systems.

Requirements:

1. Systems Experience:
• Mandatory experience with Payroll, Workforce Management (WFM), and/or Core HR systems and their integrations.

2. Communication and Collaboration:
• Demonstrated excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, along with strong collaboration abilities.

3. Project Experience:
• Experience working on complex projects/programs of work from end to end, ideally within a PMO environment.

4. Ambiguity Handling:
• Ability to thrive in an environment with ambiguity and lead discussions to achieve clarity in project outcomes.

5. Interpersonal Skills:
• Strong interpersonal skills to challenge the status quo and drive change when needed.

6. Organizational Skills:
• Excellent planning, organizational, coordination, and time management skills.

7. Results-Oriented:
• Proven ability to deliver exceptional results, both as part of a team and individually.

This is a unique opportunity to work on a complex program of work and bring/build your expertise while contributing to the transformation of the company's people systems. If you are a skilled Business Analyst looking for a challenging role with a dynamic and growing organization, I encourage you to apply.

For more information please apply.

Office of the CIO, Digital Health and Informatics are looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Developer to join their team.

The purpose of this role is to support and enhance the existing Metro South Business Data & Analytics Service with a responsibility for reporting and data warehousing, primarily with CCL, SQL Server and associated Microsoft tools.
The role will participate in the accurate delivery of data to various clinical units throughout the Health Service.

Metro South Healthis Australia's first digital health service and one of the largest in Queensland, with an estimated residential population of approximately one million people or 23 per cent of Queensland's population.

This is your opportunity to join the dedicated team of professionals at Metro South Health and be part of a world-class, dynamic and growing health service that embraces technology, excellence in health care, teaching, research and empowering our people to be the best in serving our community.
About the Role
Fulfil the accountabilities and responsibilities of this role in accordance with Metro South's purpose and objectives, as outlined below.

Development of queries to extract data from clinical systems, specifically the enterprise Electronic Medical Record application (Cerner) via Cerner Command Language (CCL).
Lead and collaborate in the creating and updating of ETL packages.

We offer rewarding career opportunities across a wide range of clinical and non-clinical areas across our health service and pride ourselves on providing a work environment that is safe, satisfying, flexible, and promotes a healthy work-life balance.

Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. We’re on a mission to make flying better than ‘nice’. And to do that, it takes a team of talented people who are passionate about customer experience, doing the right thing always, with a focus on safety – in the air, on the ground and in our workplaces. A team who values real diversity and inclusion, in a big brand with big ambitions.

What you’ll be doing

The objective of the Business Improvement Specialist role is to support the review and simplification of end to end processes of all key Finance functions including, but not exclusive to, Month end close, Management reporting, Financial control, Procurement and Treasury.
• Review and analysis of current Finance processes and systems using a logical, systematic and sequential approach
• Ability to question current state, weigh relevance of information, understand interdependencies, evaluate alternative perspectives/ solutions and drive the implementation of improved end to end processes
• Working with internal teams, including Finance Systems, Robotics, BI, Risk and Legal as required
• Customer focus; anticipate and meet the needs of internal customers.
• Develops and maintains effective working relationships, especially in challenging situations. Engages, inspires and empowers others
• Develop clear business cases for change. Document new standardised processes for business application
• Administration of concurrent project activity from ideation through to implementation and benefit realisation
• Timely and appropriate governance and risk management in regard to program of work including the production or reporting artefacts, managing blockers

You’ll be great in this role if you…
• Tertiary qualification in Business or similar
• At least 2 years' experience in Business Analyst role, Project Management role or similar (ideally within Finance, not IT)
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills: describes expectations, goals, requests, or future states in a way that provides clarity and promotes buy-in
• Experience developing business cases for change
• Advanced Excel, BI skills
• Ability to recognise a wide range of potential difficult issues, problems or opportunities and develop strategies in achieving the best outcomes
• Experience with applying timely and appropriate governance and risk management in regard to programs of work

We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to):
• Discounted flights for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
• A flexible, hybrid work style. Work from home or the office, adapt your location to suit your style and needs
• One of Brisbane’s most admired head office locations, with South Bank train station, a supermarket, pharmacy, and lunch options downstairs plus a 5-minute walk to the Busway, a rooftop restaurant and onsite gym (with a low membership fee) and South Bank Parklands just across the road
• Discounts on travel insurance, lounge membership, car hire, accommodation, and experiences worldwide
• Cheaper hospitality, retail, technology, beauty and wellness services
• Free counselling and access to a wellbeing app to support your physical, mental, social and financial health
• Dress for Your Day’ – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever makes you feel great for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you.

When everyone is included, everyone wins

We’re all individuals. And we love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.

Talent International is searching for an experienced Power BI Reports Developer to join our client, a large state government department. This role is based in Brisbane CBD on a contract basis until February 2024.

About The Role
• Support the activities of project teams and undertake planning, analysis and evaluate significant stages of projects for the purpose of ensuring strategic objectives.
• Collect, collate, analyse and, where appropriate, disseminate human resource information for use by other officers.

About Us:

At Auto & General (A&G), we provide great products and services to safeguard our customers in their time of need. Our range of general insurance products protects customers on the road, at home and on holiday with various Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents, and Pet products as well as Roadside Assistance.

Our culture of 'high performance with high integrity' underpins our values and the way we interact with our customers, the community and each other. We're excited about the future and we're always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia's best insurer If this sounds like you, apply today.

The Role:

The Pricing Data Scientist will be responsible for undertaking advanced analytics and data science services to support the Pricing Team. This includes developing and implementing best practice predictive models, exploring the use of new or existing data assets, and providing expert support on process improvements. You will also need to provide advice and report on the impact of key Pricing decisions and operational activities on the portfolio.

To be successful in this role, the Pricing Data Scientist should have an appreciation of traditional Pricing approaches and understand the strengths and weaknesses of alternative approaches. They should be able to demonstrate an innovative approach to problem-solving and possess excellent communication skills that target a non-technical audience.

Accountabilities:
• Manage the end-to-end development and implementation of a range of predictive models that support the business to make better decisions.
• Review the modelling process including data preparation, modelling, review, implementation and monitoring as well as make recommendations for continuous improvements.
• Support the Actuarial Team's approach to technical pricing by developing approaches for more efficient processing of external data, classification of assets or use of available information.
• Evaluate and manage complex changes to models and their implications.
• Create test plans, manage and sign-off testing for all business-wide IT changes that impact pricing.

Knowledge and Experience:
• 5+ years general insurance industry experience.
• Experience with developing and implementing a range of predictive models for various purposes.
• Proven analytical and problem-solving capability.
• Clear understanding of statistical modelling techniques and, in particular, modern modelling techniques (e.g. machine learning).
• Superior communication skills that include stakeholder management and development of high-quality board papers.
• Familiarity with statistical software packages (e.g. SAS, R, SQL) is advantageous.
• Degree qualified in mathematics, statistics, actuarial studies or similar.

Our Perks:
• Location – Our office is conveniently based in Toowong Village shopping centre - a city fringe location with access to retail, restaurants, various parking options and public transport.
• Extra leave - Enjoy additional leave days on us You'll receive a paid 'ME' day and one paid volunteer leave day annually. Team members can also purchase up to two additional weeks of leave per year.
• Paid parental leave - We support our new parents with paid parental leave and other benefits.
• Workplace giving - If you're passionate about a cause, then we are too – we offer workplace giving and we'll dollar-match your donations to registered charities.
• Development opportunities - We're championing your development with internal programs and access to a wide range of online courses.
• Employee discounts - You'll receive discounts on Budget Direct insurance products.
• Reward and recognition - We reward high performance with employee recognition, reward and incentive schemes.
• Onsite facilities – There are excellent end-of-trip facilities on offer and private spaces for nursing mothers.
• Get social - Join our vibrant social and community activities including annual celebrations, family fun days and regular events across each of our sites.
• Perks App - Access to an employee benefits and discounts app called 'Perks' offering your great discounts, offers and programs across a range of areas.

If you are seeking a new challenge and would enjoy the opportunity to work in a growing and changing business, click on the APPLY NOW button and submit your application.

Unlock your potential and become an expert at developing data-driven business strategies. Get 10 weeks of training and launch your career with some of Australia's top four banks. Don't miss this chance to gain invaluable skills and carve out a career in the competitive market.

About the Role

This role is suited for people who have a technical and commercial mindset and who are excellent communicators.

As an FDM Business Intelligence Analyst you will use your investigative and problem-solving skills to analyse data and uncover trends that deliver actionable insights for the business. Through our accredited training you will be taught data preparation and analysis, and business analysis. You’ll learn how to work with databases and use tools such as Power BI, SSIS and SQL to create visualisations. Following training you will be placed with our industry-leading clients as an FDM Consultant.

What we offer you
• A full-time employment contract with job security
• Industry recognised accredited training, covering both technical and professional skills to ensure you are business ready
• Opportunity to work with our market leading clients, as part of their integrated teams.
• Relocation support where applicable for training and assignment(s)

We ask you have the following
• Educated to a university degree level (bachelor or higher), no STEM degree required
• Demonstrable interest and desire to work in technology
• Ability to commit to completing our full 2.5-year graduate program
• Ability to relocate to Sydney or Melbourne to support our clients. (Relocation package will be provided)
• Eligible to work in Australia (Australian citizen or permanent resident)

Benefits
• Relocation Support
• Buy As You Earn (BAYE) share plan
• Wellbeing Programme
• Mentoring Programme
• Online Learning and Development Programme
• Consultant Peer Support Programme connecting new and existing FDMers
• FDM Staff Networks
• Employee Recognition Awards
• Consultant Collaboration Platform

There has never been a better time to start a career in tech – Apply Now!

About FDM

Our people are our passion. That's why we make your training and career growth our priority. We are a global professional services provider, focusing on IT. We are also one of the Australia's leading graduate employers, recruiting the brightest talent to become the innovators of tomorrow. With centres across Europe, North America, and Asia-Pacific, and over 5,000 consultants placed on client site globally, FDM has shown exponential growth throughout the years, firmly establishing itself as an award-winning FTSE 250 employer.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

FDM Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, provincial, or local laws.

• ‘Work where it works’ for you and your clients
• Be part of a team where everyone belongs, and individuality is celebrated
• Contribute to the financial wellbeing of our 2 million+ clients across Australia

The difference you will make at Insignia Financial

In the role of the Salesforce Technical Business Analyst, you will take an active and forward-looking approach to enhance project delivery. This includes providing leadership to analysts and collaborating closely with the Delivery Manager to ensure the successful execution of team activities and deliverables.

You Will Make a Difference By
• Conducting in-depth technical analysis, addressing complex business requirements and processes
• Serving as a pivotal link between stakeholders and the delivery team, taking charge of complex issues across various applications that involve multiple parties
• Evaluating existing processes and systems, offering recommendations for process enhancements
• Providing subject matter expertise and conduct business analysis for intricate projects
• Developing position statements on complex subject matter inquiries
• Assisting in Incident Management during Business as Usual (BAU) operations, identifying the root causes and facilitating defect remediation within stipulated SLAs
• Providing comprehensive support throughout the end-to-end delivery process, including technical requirements, testing, and change management for planned releases and maintenance windows as needed

A Little Bit About You
• Possess business and/or technology expertise, acquired within the Financial Services sector or other related industries
• Extensive experience, with a significant portion dedicated to working with Salesforce
• Hold tertiary qualifications or possess equivalent industry experience
• Demonstrate prior experience in various business practices, with a particular focus on Financial Services, especially in superannuation and fund management
• Expert in systems design, integration, and function/data analysis within specific business functions
• Exhibit effective communication and interpersonal skills, crucial for effective stakeholder engagement, including the ability to conduct showcases
• Adopt a proactive approach to problem-solving, critical thinking, and the identification of opportunities for improvement
• Lead by example by embodying the culture and values that align with the expectations of the team and Insignia Financial

Life at Insignia Financial

From people just starting out, to those about to retire – every day we help more Australians secure their future. Helping our clients reach their financial goals sooner is our specialty. Few others can match the range of wealth management products and services we offer.

Insignia Financial is an ASX Top 200 company, and one of one of Australia’s leading wealth managers. We use our scale and expertise to invest in a future that’s better for everyone. We believe success comes from caring about people, consistent performance, and outstanding service. And we recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference: this applies to employees and clients alike.

Diversity and ensuring our people feel they belong is important to us, we take pride in putting our people, as well as our clients, first and value and celebrate diversity within all our teams.

We have a Women in Technology community which exists to bring together female and non-binary people within the tech world at Insignia Financial. This supportive forum is eager to progress and make change in the technology space – does this sound like you?

With many of us now working from home more than the office, we understand the importance of flexibility. As we work in a hybrid environment, you’ll ‘work where it works’ for you, your team, and our clients. We also offer varied and flexible leave offerings, including 12 weeks paid parental leave and an extra day of leave each year.

We encourage our people to have an impact on the broader community we serve through volunteering leave.

At Insignia Financial, it’s important to us that our people feel secure about their own money. We have an extensive financial wellbeing offering available to our people, including access to financial advice, mortgage, and insurance brokers, Will and estate planning services and more.

Join us and contribute to achieving our ambition of creating financial wellbeing for all Australians through living our Principles: be human, deliver what matters, stronger together, keep it simple and do what’s right, not what’s easy.

To apply

Please submit your resume with a covering letter by clicking on "Apply Now".

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.

Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.

At Insignia Financial, we have a culture of belonging. We are an ‘every person’ organisation that welcomes and appreciates everyone for who they are. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of your personal circumstances, please reach out and let us know. We recognise and celebrate the value of individual difference.

Downer's Road Services business is one of the largest non-government owned road services businesses in Australia. We operate from a network of over 50 depots and maintain more than 36,000 km of road.

An exciting career opportunity is available for Junior Machine Learning and Data Analyst to assist in the development and implementation of digital solutions including machine learning, artificial intelligence and MS Azure Power Platform for data collection, analysis and management.

ABOUT YOU
• An understanding of machine learning and object detection technologies with a desire to further develop in this area. Experience with Azure ML will be highly regarded.
• Degree qualified in computer science or equivalent tertiary qualification with quantitative research experience.
• A double degree with Civil Engineering is highly desired.
• Programming machine learning/artificial intelligence for data capture and / or optimisation.
• Sound knowledge of Python and SQL.
• Developing with Power Automate, Power Apps and Power BI.
• Preferable knowledge of road asset management concepts.
• Preferable 2 years of industry work experience.
• The ability to evaluate information quickly, identify key issues and formulate decisions.
• Well-developed communication skills with the ability to work collaboratively with all stakeholders including operational teams.
• Have a willingness and enthusiasm to learn road maintenance concepts and the application of workflow management systems.

WHAT WE OFFER

At Downer, our approach to diversity is what sets us apart. Our people can be their best by bringing their most authentic selves to work every day. Analysis & Reporting (Banking & Financial Services)
An exciting opportunity to join BOQ as a Senior Data Management Analyst during our transformation journey. By joining the digital bank of the future, you will be able to make a difference with integrity and empathy, overseeing the successful and effective analysis of the data quality capability adding significant value to our organisation.
As a Senior Data Management Analyst, you will be working closely with the Group Technology Team that consists of Business Analysts, Developers and Testers. Reporting to the Manager of Data Management, you will be responsible for supporting the execution of data initiatives that enable our bankers to have access to trusted, governed and easily available data which supports their needs.
In this role you will ensure data management practices are conducted in line with statutory, regulatory, audit and risk expectations. Furthermore, you will support operations of the Data Management Framework which includes data principles, policy, standards, and guidelines ensuring their pragmatic and beneficial application to data platforms and the wider data ecosystem. You will also be involved in conducting awareness and training initiatives to create a measurable uplift in data literacy and data handling skills across the bank.
About you
As an experienced data management and analytics professional, you will be a collaborative outcome and people focussed individual who thrives on working in a fast-paced environment. You will have 6+ years of experience working in enterprise data platforms (Data Warehousing, Data Analytics Data Governance or BI) with an ability to manipulate and analyse large amounts of data using SQL queries and map data from source to target.
Alongside your experience working with third party vendors and developing lasting relationships to ensure success, you will have a strong understanding and practical experience in data quality, data management/governance frameworks and methodologies.
About Us
BOQ is one of Australia's leading regional banks and provides a genuine alternative for Australian financial services customers and employees. Our purpose is to create prosperity for our customers, shareholders and people through empathy, integrity and by making a difference. Our ambition is to be known as the bold challenger bank; with multi-brands that are digitally enabled with a personal touch.
BOQ is passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and collaborative environment with a strong focus on community.
BOQ's Inclusion vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities, a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.
Since 2021 BOQ Group is recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA).
Flexible working arrangements
Discounted financial products
Salary sacrificing options
Paid parental leave with no minimum
Purchase annual leave
Discounted private health insurance plan
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
5 employee diversity network groups focusing on: First Nations Reconciliation Council, Proudly ME (LGBTIQA+), Multicultural, Gender and Early Career
BOQ Group is a member of Pride in Diversity and a participating organisation in the Australian Workplace Equality Index

How to Apply
To apply for this role please apply via our Careers Page.
The Bank of Queensland is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.
If you are successful for a role with the Bank of Queensland, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to: identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, bankruptcy checks.

Job Description
• The main responsibilities of this role include -
• Assist in the preparation of reports and building complex data models
• Devise new data collection and analysis processes
• Work with key stakeholders to priorities information needs
• Analyse results and report findings to the business
• Identify and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
• Develop strategies to optimise the quality of statistical results
• Maintain database
• Research background materials, including relevant economic and financial data
• Assist in the development of long-range financial forecasts and related budgets

The Successful Applicant

The Successful Applicant will have the following -
• Bachelors degree in Business / Commerce or related discipline
• Ideally 1-3 years of experience, however, will also consider graduates straight from University
• Intermediate Excel skills
• Strong analytic skills and problem solving
• Strong communication skills
• Proficient in Power BI (preferred)

What's on Offer
• New office currently being built
• Opportunity to develop and enhance career
• flexible working arrangements
• Work closely with the CFO
• Attractive remuneration and bonus
• Flexible working arrangements

ASAP start on a 2-week project based between the West End office with the option of working from home half the time.

Competitive rate of $60-$70 per hour.

Opportunity to get project exposure in a large, exciting multi-Sector organization.

Flexible start and finish times.

About the role

Skout is looking for a skilled Data Analyst to Clean and interpret data across the business’s various Enterprise agreements and cross reference to casual wages paid to turn into information for the Strategy Manager to then present to management.

About you

Advanced experience in Excel and proficiency in Power BI.

Demonstrated proof of data analytics project experience or background.

Would suit a recent graduate who’s had experience working on cleaning and interpreting data in an agile environment.

About the company

Skout Solutions is all about connecting people with opportunity. We sit within Ventia providing them with the talent they need to thrive and grow. As a Joint Venture with Randstad and Ventia we have access to the latest recruitment and HR technologies and Human Resources support. Ventia is a leading infrastructure services company, operating across Australia and New Zealand. Our clients are the owners and operators of assets that are critical to our local communities.

Diversity

We acknowledge the importance of our people’s diverse experiences, talents, and cultures. Embracing diversity and creating inclusion is a key component of our talent strategy. The creation of a diverse, inclusive workforce is central to our ability to unlock potential and enhance our success.

Aboriginal and Torres strait Islander people are encouraged to apply for this vacancy.

How to apply

Please follow the link to apply or send your resume to Benjamin.coles@skoutsolutions.com if you are interested in the opportunity and meet the requirements for this position.

Who are you?

We are looking for a person with a true desire to learn and the motivation to improve yourself and your skills every day. You love the idea of immersing yourself in data to drive meaningful insights and create jaw-dropping outcomes. You’ll need creativity to deliver those outcomes in meaningful, digestible forms.

Who we are

At the Data School, we don’t look at what’s on your CV or your experience. We want to create the next generation of first-class data analysts and data scientists. If you are passionate about data, we have the best way for you to get into a new career in data.

How does it work?

Successful applicants will be immersed in 4 months of intensive training using market-leading technologies – Tableau, PowerBI, SQL, and Alteryx.

In addition, you will hone all the soft skills needed to become an outstanding consultant.

The training is followed by four 6-month client engagements with Australia's leading organisations to give you real-world experience to kick-start your new career.

Do I get paid?

Yes. The Data School offers you a competitive salary while you gain valuable industry experience.

More details
• $60,000 per annum that will increase in the second year
• 28-month, fixed-term contract to start your new career as a data consultant
• When you finish the contract, you can stay on as a consultant and continue to work on some fascinating projects or go it alone. Either way, we are here to help every step of the way. On completion, you will also become part of our Alumni network
• We’re sorry – we can’t sponsor you, so make sure you have full working rights
• Work from our office in the CBD
• For more information about us you can read here: https://www.thedataschool.com.au/school/

Application Process
• Join Tableau - Join the community and download Tableau Public
• Find your data - Choose a dataset that you are passionate about; from politics to sport, TV and popular culture. You can find data on sites like Kaggle, Data.world, data.gov.au, or the Tableau resources page
• Create your Viz - Once you have your data set, you can begin creating your winning viz! Find insights and use interactivity to tell a compelling story
• Share it with us - Once your work is live on Tableau Public, send it to us using the application form on our website: https://www.thedataschool.com.au/apply/apply-now/
• The Interview - If you impress us with your passion, innovation and understanding of data, you will be invited to an interview

Key dates

For all of our applications closing dates look here: https://www.thedataschool.com.au/apply/
• We are taking applications at all times. If you have an inquisitive nature, and a passion for getting to the truth by way of data, then we’d love to hear from you!

About the role

Data Analyst - Retail Analytics (Customer Migration)

Role Location: Melbourne/Brisbane

Role Type: Permanent Full Time

At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We’re making this happen by improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our customers so they can achieve incredible things– whether they’re buying a home, building a business or saving for things big or small.

This Data Analyst role is part of Retail Analytics and sits in our Initiatives – Migration squad where our mission is to help customers achieve their goals by migrating them to products that better support the ways they save, use and manage their money, pay and get paid. We use design excellence to reimagine processes and iterate capabilities that will support customer migration.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the overall delivery of the team's goals and priorities. You will manage pieces of work, develop data driven insights and reports that will enhance and support the objectives of the Customer Migration Portfolio.

As a Data Analyst, you deeply understand the power of data to generate quality customer insight, manage information, identify trends and make decisions. You will consult with stakeholders to understand business problems and collaborate with other data practitioners to design and deliver appropriate solutions.

What will your day look like
• Address and solve complex business issues using large amounts of data
• Source data from a variety of sources to combine, synthesise and analyse to generate insights
• Continuous generation, monitoring, presenting and conducting of 'fact-based' analysis of relevant customer insights to use at any time for the development and improvement of relevant and innovative propositions
• Generate, monitor, present and analyse relevant customer insights, costs, benefits, and risks for customers, clients and cohort products; this could include business casing, what if scenarios and opportunity sizing & assessments

What will you bring?

We know not everyone will bring all of the skills and experience, and at ANZ we are focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Some of the skills we are looking for are below, but don’t worry if you don’t have all of these as learning on the job is the way we work.

But back to some of the skills
• To grow and be successful in the role, you will ideally bring the following:
• Analytical and inquisitive mindset to continuously improve the level of insight surfaced
• Ability to translate data insights into practical business recommendations
• Strong communication and presentation skills
• Proficiency in SQL for handling large complex datasets of varying types

ICT Contractor Position Description

POSITION TITLE:

Senior Data Analyst

LOCATION:

111 George Street, Brisbane

CLOSING DATE:

COB Friday, 4 November 2022

HIRING MANAGER:

Tania Vicary

POSITION CONTACT:

Director

Department overview

The Department of Children, Youth Justice and Multicultural Affairs (CYJMA) recognise Queensland comprises communities of diverse cultural backgrounds who have varying needs and aspirations, and who rely on diverse industries for their livelihoods.

In response to this, the Department works in partnership across government, with local communities, non-government organisations and the private sector to achieve the best outcomes for Queenslanders.

By working with us, you will have the opportunity to work with staff from across the department to resolve complex issues and change life trajectories.

About Unify

CYJMA has commenced a four-year journey to implement a new contemporary and coordinated case management system for vulnerable children, young people and families. The Unify Program has been established to deliver this new system to support current and future child safety and youth justice needs through adaptable technology that can support changes to practice as reform occurs over time.

The program will be comprised of a series of joined up projects to provide new integrated and innovative legislation, practice and performance frameworks and business processes, enabled by technology and underpinned by a human-centered design approach.

The program focuses on three critical capabilities:
• It is client-centric: supporting targeted, needs-based responses to children, young people, parents, families, carers and communities while delivering earlier and more effective interventions.
• It is integration-enabling: designed around collaboration and information sharing, enabling connected and integrated responses to clients across government agencies and non-government partners.
• It is data driven, enabling the effective monitoring of outcomes to improve the experiences of children, young people and families and ensures that future investment is directed to what works.

Purpose of the position

The purpose of this position is to provide high quality data analysis, mapping and modelling to the Unify program for the delivery of Child and Family and Youth Justice Products.

The position will be required to engage and work closely with a range of stakeholders to analyse data needs, gather and document requirements, and develop artefacts. The position will play a critical role in understanding the data required for migration, cleansing, viewing and ultimately reporting. In this role one has to work very closely with transactional systems business analysts to build logical/physical data models for the department’s business processes and manage common data model that satisfies requirements.

The successful applicant will be able to demonstrate the capacity to work within a multi-specialist team and deliver to tight timeframes and deadlines (and rapidly changing priorities).

Key responsibilities
• Undertake data mapping against an ICT solution and identify the delivery of data sets to support Product delivery
• Understand business needs and processes to identify, analyse and document detailed data requirements
• Work with business representatives to determine priorities and validate and justify the requirements
• Participate in data extract, transformation and migration activities
• Work with development teams and other skilled analysts to validate functionality against the data requirements
• Provide timely, strategic and expert advice regarding data requirements, information requirements, business impacts, scope management, and project risks
• Manage the delivery of work to a schedule and assist in the setting and managing of expectations
• Use high level communication skills to negotiate, establish, and maintain networks and working relationships
• Apply standardised templates, methodologies and processes for data analysis activities and related project documentation
• Lead and work collaboratively with a wide range of staff at all levels
• Contribute to business integration, change management, and testing activities
• Actively manage a working environment supporting quality human resource management practices including employment equity, anti-discrimination, occupational health and safety, and ethical behaviour.

Essential requirements

The applicant must demonstrate:
• Demonstrated experience in data ingestion, cleansing, manipulation and modelling.
• Experience in eliciting, analysing, specifying, documenting and validating the business data needs of stakeholders.
• Data/reports development skills and experience relevant to the position
• Understanding and experience working with applications that utilise complex relational architecture
• Experience working within a large, complex multi-disciplinary organisation
• High level of written communication and documentation skills
• Proven effective communication and stakeholder engagement skills and experience
• Proven ability to manage a large workload whilst maintaining high levels of accuracy

Desirable requirements
• Data and ETL experience especially with Microsoft Azure Cloud Data Platform (Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Profisee, Azure Data Verse)
• Ability to write complex SQL scripts, queries, and stored procedures to extract and mine data.
• Experience in developing complex reports, including consideration of complex business rules and data architecture
• Knowledge and understanding of the public sector Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Environment.
• See projects through to completion, monitoring project progress and adjusting plans as required.
• Take personal responsibility for meeting objectives and progressing work. Demonstrate initiative and proactively steps in and does what is required. Commits energy and drive to see that goals are achieved.
• Consults and shares information and ensures others are kept informed of issues.
• Experience in agile projects methodology.

Deliverables
• Document business data requirements and entity relationship at logical and physical levels and maintenance for business products
• Develop a data dictionary, detailed data flow diagrams, specifications, and other project related artefacts and documentation as required by the project/program management leadership team.
• Document and implement work package activities
• Assist stakeholders with User Acceptance Testing

Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that consideration of employing a public servant for this role was carried out and there was no public servant available to fill the requirements of this position.

Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. We’re on a mission to make flying better than ‘nice’. And to do that, it takes a team of talented people who are passionate about customer experience, doing the right thing always, with a focus on safety – in the air, on the ground and in our workplaces. A team who values real diversity and inclusion, in a big brand with big ambitions.

What you’ll be doing

We are looking for an Advanced Analytics Specialist to join our team. This exciting role has a wide variety and breadth of work. It will give you the opportunity to grow and gain great exposure to various parts of the business. The areas span across operations, commercial (airfare pricing and revenue management), econometrics, elasticity, and network optimization.

Key accountabilities
• Utilize a variety of statistical and analytic methods to generate data models to help predict and explain commercial and operational trends to senior leadership and other division stakeholders.
• Perform ad hoc analysis to support multiple departments by compiling historical data as well as forecasting future trends.
• Research and evaluate industry trends, practices, and operational methodologies to continually improve overall company operational philosophy and performance.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to validate and improve existing assumptions and processes.
• Communicate informed conclusions and recommendations to senior leadership to improve business processes.
• Champion a culture of analytics and serve as a centre of excellence for trusted data integrity and analysis needs.

You’ll be great in this role if you…
• Minimum of 4 years’ experience in Advanced Analytics
• Previous data science and operations research experience.
• Ability to take complex mathematical concepts and communicate business relevance to key business stakeholders from front-line operations up to executive level management.
• Ability to write database queries for successful data analysis.
• Use of machine learning on large data sets to identify drivers and make predictions.
• Creation of optimisation models to reduce cost and increase revenue.
• Advanced Excel based user including Power Query & PowerPivot. Modelling languages such as PowerBI, DAX, R, Python, and SQL.
• Ability to create various predictive and operational models as required.
• Simulation models including Monte Carlo and Discrete Event.
• Experience with EMSR optimisation and other airline operations research is highly desirable.

We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to):
• Discounted flights for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year)
• A flexible, hybrid work style. Work from home or the office, adapt your location to suit your style and needs

• Discounts on travel insurance, lounge membership, car hire, accommodation, and experiences worldwide
• Cheaper hospitality, retail, technology, beauty and wellness services
• Free counselling and access to a wellbeing app to support your physical, mental, social and financial health
• ‘Dress for Your Day’ – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever makes you feel great for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you.

When everyone is included, everyone wins

We’re all individuals. And we love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family.

Ready to apply?

We’re ready to hear from you. Apply now.

About the team

In today’s fast-changing legal, regulatory and compliance environment, threats such as fraud, corruption and money laundering are very real and carry with them potentially significant reputational, financial and criminal impacts. That’s why our work is more important (and exciting) than ever. Deloitte Discovery and Data Management is comprised of eDiscovery, eHearings, forensic technology, forensic accountants, data scientists, legal professionals, technology evangelists and former law enforcement officers.

Our approach emphasizes leveraging leadership, technology, workflows, and processes to extract maximum value for our clients whilst assisting them managing associated risks.

What will your typical day look like?

As a Manager in Deloitte Discovery and Data Management, you will serve as a trusted advisor on eDiscovery matters for clients within legal and regulatory domains. Employing a strategic perspective, methodical problem-solving, strong consulting skills, and meticulous planning, you will use your technical and compliance knowledge to solve complex data challenges.

You’ll also be expected to:
• Conduct meticulous eDiscovery assessments (potentially including collection, preservation, data analysis, document review strategies, and technology adoption) to identify and quantify case opportunities and risks
• Guiding clients in optimising their processes through the adoption of existing and emerging technologies
• Work closely with the other Managers within the team to deliver eDiscovery, eForensic and eHearings offerings
• Contribute to the expansion of our eDiscovery capabilities through thought leadership development and support in business development activities
• Coach and mentor our impressive and growing junior team and contribute to the Deloitte Discovery global framework

Enough about us—let's talk about you.

You possess:
• At least 4 years of experience in legal consulting, litigation support, or related roles, ideally gained at prominent law firms, eDiscovery consultancies, or tech-focused legal departments. This is provided as guidance, and we encourage all relevant candidates to apply
• Innate problem-solving skills, structured thinking, and the ability to deconstruct complex issues into manageable components for analysis
• Familiarity with the legal landscape, litigation processes, and the technical aspects of eDiscovery
• Experienced in the use of eDiscovery tools such as Relativity, Nuix, Transpire or Reveal
• Exceptional analytical abilities
• Effective communication skills, both written and oral, including presentation proficiency
• Practical commercial acumen, enabling you to identify and mitigate legal risks
• Experience in leading cross-functional teams throughout eDiscovery phases, from initial assessment to post-case follow-up
• Proven adaptability to fast-paced environments, along with a readiness to navigate uncertainty and change
• Project management expertise, encompassing planning, oversight, and successful project completion
• A background in staff development, combined with a willingness to guide and mentor junior colleagues
• Willingness to travel as required by project demands and client engagements.

Why Deloitte?  

At Deloitte, we focus our energy on interesting and impactful work. We’re always learning, innovating and setting the standard; making a positive difference to our clients and our society. We put coaching at the heart of what we do, helping our people grow their careers in any direction – whether it be up, moving into something new, or even moving across the world.  

We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion. We have a diverse collection of people from different backgrounds, with different experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. What binds us together is a shared commitment to value everyone’s perspective and to cultivate inclusion; so that our work environment is a safe space we can all belong. 

We prioritise flexibility and choice. At Deloitte, you get trust on Day 1. We know our people get their best work done when they’re in control of where and how they work, designing their work week around their client, team and personal commitments.

We help you live and work well. To support your personal and professional life, we offer a range of perks and benefits, including retail discounts, wellbeing leave, paid volunteering days, twelve flexible working options, market-leading parental leave and return to work support package. 

Next Steps

Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now, we’d love to hear from you

By applying to this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.

At Deloitte, we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another; prioritise respect, fairness, development and wellbeing; foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background, experience, identity, ability or thinking style, and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request.

The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.

Take the next step. Be part of something bigger at Suncorp.
