data.job_title: Data Analyst - Student Enrichment and Employability Development
data.job_description:
• Student Enrichment and Employability Development (SEED)
• Exciting and challenging working environment with a great team culture.
• Utilise your strong analytical and technical skills to build data sets that support business decisions and product improvements.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams and develop reporting requirements.
• Based at our St Lucia campus

About UQ

As part of the UQ community, you’ll have the opportunity to work alongside the brightest minds, who have joined us from all over the world.

Everyone here has a role to play. As a member of our professional staff cohort, you will be actively involved in working towards our vision of a better world. By supporting the academic endeavour across teaching, research, and the student life, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to activities that have a lasting impact on our community.

Join a community where excellence is at the core of our culture, contributions are valued and a range of benefits and rewards are available, such as:
• 26 weeks paid parental leave or 14 weeks paid primary caregiver leave.
• 17% superannuation contributions.
• 17.5% annual leave loading.
• Access to flexible working arrangements including hybrid working options, flexible start/finish times, purchased leave, and a condensed fortnight.
• Health and wellness discounts – fitness passport access, free yearly flu vaccinations, discounted health insurance, and access to our Employee Assistance Program for staff and their immediate family.
• On campus childcare options.
• Cheap parking (from just $5 a day).
• Salary packaging options.

About This Opportunity

The Data Analyst is responsible for analysing data sourced by and on behalf of the Student Affairs Division from across the University, in order to respond to the day-to-day needs of various areas of the Division. This position will undertake analysis to identify trends and opportunities for growth to support the student experience and will play a lead role in the development of annual divisional reporting.

Key responsibilities include:
• Working in partnership to identify and develop divisional service metrics.
• Collecting, collating, and interpreting data from existing data sources and providing support to develop new, and redevelop existing, data sets by contributing to specification design and quality assurance checks.
• Undertaking analysis of data sets to provide well-informed briefings and reports, identifying trends and opportunities for service delivery improvements.
• Streamlining data reporting ensuring that it meets the needs of Student Affairs and wider University stakeholders.
• Maintaining awareness of relevant technology and software improvements that may benefit the collection, integration, presentation, and analysis of data within UQ to support programs and initiatives that enhance the student experience.

This is a full-time, continuing (permanent) position.

At HEW level 7, the full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $93,254 to $101,680, plus a generous super allowance of up to 17%. The total FTE package will be up to $109,107 to $118,966 annually.

About You
• Completion of an undergraduate degree, with experience in a relevant area, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training.
• Demonstrated ability to compile and manipulate complex data sets and proven analytical skills with the ability to leverage quantitative/qualitative trend data to draw conclusions related to the student experience provided by the division.
• Excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to design and produce clear, concise, and accurate advice and briefing papers on complex issues. A proven ability to be highly organised and self-managing, including a demonstrated capacity to establish work priorities, meet timelines and achieve project management priorities, work independently and accept responsibility.
• Highly developed interpersonal skills, including the ability to develop relationships with key stakeholders and liaise, consult, and negotiate with staff at all levels, both internally and externally.
• Awareness of issues related to the student experience, retention, and employability within higher education nationally.
• Experience in the use of the Business Objects and/or Tableau data management tool.

In addition, the following mandatory requirements apply:
• Work Rights: You must have unrestricted work rights in Australia for the duration of this appointment to apply. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment.
• Background Checks: All final applicants for this position may be asked to consent to a criminal record check. Please note that people with criminal records are not automatically barred from applying for this position. Each application will be considered on its merits.

Questions?

For more information about this opportunity, please contact Paul Dwan at p.dwan@uq.edu.au. For application queries, please contact recruitment@uq.edu.au stating the job reference number (below) in the subject line.

Want to Apply?

To submit an application for this role, go to the UQ Careers portal and use the Apply button.

All applicants must upload the following documents in order for your application to be considered:
• Cover letter addressing the ‘About You’ section.
• Resume

Other Information

At UQ we know that our greatest strengths come from our diverse mix of colleagues, this is reflected in our ongoing commitment to creating an environment focused on equity, diversity and inclusion. We ensure that we are always attracting, retaining and promoting colleagues who are representative of the diversity in the broader community, whether that be gender identity, LGBTQIA+, cultural and/or linguistic, Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander peoples, or people with a disability. Accessibility requirements and/or adjustments can be directed to recruitment@uq.edu.au

Applications close Monday 2 October 2023 at 11.00pm AEST (Job Reference Number - R-30511). Please note that interviews have been tentatively scheduled for 11 October 2023.

Provide analytics for complex financial crime investigations (combining fraud + AML) and critical projects. • Track, manage and assess issues using data analytics, and supporting issue resolution

• Contribute to the development, review and update of process and system documentation

About You

To be successful in this role you will have an analytical mindset and and strong communications skills with the ability to communicate complex technical information accurately.
• Relevant tertiary qualification or training towards
• Training/qualifications Data Science and/or Technical Business Analysis (preferred), Financial Crime Risk e.g. AML/CTF or KYC or Fraud (desirable)

data.job_title: Volunteer Data Analytics and Software Developer
data.job_description:
Volunteer Data Analytics and Software Developer

Salary: Volunteer

Hours: Minimum fifteen hours weekly

Contract: Minimum six-month commitment

Location: Brisbane, Australia. Remote candidates are welcome to apply.

Why join THRIVE?

Looking for a role where you can be part of a collaborative, mission-led group? Hoping to build a network of global contacts and develop your teamwork skills?

When you become a volunteer at THRIVE, you’ll receive:
• Free induction, training, and mentorship sessions
• The opportunity to develop your presentation skills
• Access to global connections (including VIPs)
• Guidance and education from experienced volunteers
• The chance to land a paid job

What is THRIVE?

THRIVE stands for The Holistic Regenerative Innovative Value Entity. As a not-for-profit for-impact initiative, we aim to place humankind on a more sustainable path and create a ‘thrivable’ future for all.

The THRIVE Platform is a free, web-based tool that uses the best-available science to address contemporary global challenges. The THRIVE platform uses machine learning to help guide countries, cities, companies, and individuals on their journey towards a more sustainable future.

THRIVE has excellent relationships with a variety of research groups, educational bodies, and UN-affiliated policymakers.

We use educational content and free software solutions to address some of the following global challenges:
• Climate change
• Loss of biodiversity
• Deforestation
• Social inequality
• Pollution

By joining THRIVE, you will help to ensure humanity can face global issues effectively and sustainably.

The Role

We’re looking for a motivated, enthusiastic Data Analytics and Software Developer to join our friendly, global team.

Your experience will include:
• Working with google ecosystem, including studio, sheets, apps (similar to js), and SQL
• Identifying data sources, consolidating datasets, turning them into insights
• Analysing data to find answers to specific questions
• Developing and implementing SQL based queries on our existing datasets
• Generating insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns
• Preparing reports for project teams and the organisation including visualisations and storytelling

In this volunteer role, you'll learn how to develop your cloud knowledge, work in teams, and provide actionable insights, working amongst a dynamic international team who is informing and changing the world for the better.

Position Requirements
• Bachelor's degree
• Fluent in English (preferred)
• A passion for sustainability
• A collaborative team player mindset
• Excellent communication and organization skills
• Experience working in a fast-paced environment
• Well-developed problem-solving abilities
• Highly organized
• The ability to handle multiple tasks to meet strict deadlines
• Exceptional time management skills
• Ambition and proactivity

At THRIVE, we’re looking for individuals who strongly align with our mission and vision for a thrivable future. If you’re looking for an opportunity to join a growing initiative that allows you to gain valuable experience while giving back to a worthy cause, apply now.

We’re strongly committed to equal opportunities and value diversity in our workforce.

Applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Policy, Planning & Regulation, Government - State (Government & Defence)
Full time
Attractive salary of $122,686 per annum plus super

The Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (Ahpra) works in partnership with 15 National Boards to implement the national regulatory scheme for health professionals.

The purpose of health practitioner regulation is to protect the public by ensuring that only health practitioners who have the skills, qualifications, and knowledge to provide safe care are registered.

The Senior Analyst provides a fundamental role by working collaboratively between Ahpra's research and datateams to deliver high quality research and evaluation projects required for the effective regulation of health professionals.

The role is also responsible for identifying high priority areas for analysis and lead the delivery of analytical projects by using statistical thinking, methods, and processes to support regulatory policy development and decision making.
This is a full time ongoing position that can be located in any jurisdiction where there is an Ahpra presence
Provide expert methodological advice on the design of analytical projects and provide statistical services relating to sampling, survey design, and quality assurance of outputs
Perform data extractions, manipulations, and analyses, whilst assuring the quality and confidentiality of all data released for research and analysis
Develop clear protocols for research collaborations and partnerships to optimise data use for regulatory policy development and decision making
Prepare high quality technical research reports, discussion papers, briefs, minutes, and memos for a range of non-technical audiences as instructed by the Manager, Research and Evaluation

As the ideal candidate, you will demonstrate the following skills and attributes:
Tertiary qualification in statistics, mathematics, data analysis, data science, or a degree with a strong focus on research methods and data analysis, or equivalent demonstrated experience
Demonstrated experience in research using statistical analysis and thematic analysis principles, ideally within a health-capacity framework
Strong written communication skills including the demonstrated ability to concisely translate technical information for a diverse range of non-technical audiences
Demonstrate an understanding of how governments regulate in the public interest
Strong research, analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving skills
Hybrid working environment, 2 office days/3 at home
17.5% leave loading
You will receive a company laptop and working from home kit.
Inclusive and supportive colleagues, enjoy coming to work and collaborating with your team
Salary packaging arrangements including novated leasing and education expenses
Discounted health insurance with Private Health
Discounted gym membership
Attractive salary of $126,367 per annum plus Superannuation

To apply:
Click 'Apply for this job' to submit your application.
Your application must include a current resume and cover letter addressing the 'Experience" section of the Role Description (2 page maximum)
Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa. Work eligibility will be checked as part of the recruitment process
Applications must be submitted by 11.30pm AEST on 1 October 2023

Offers of employment are subject to successful background (pre-employment screening) and Criminal History checks.
Ahpra is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion.

We strongly encourage people of all abilities to apply, particularly people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, and those who may experience diversity or disability related barriers in securing employment.
If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application.
Ahpra acknowledges the Traditional Owners of Country throughout Australia and the continuing connection to lands, waters, and communities. We pay our respects to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures and Elders past, present, and emerging.
Reviews from people working in the industry

About us

Vincents is a national, multi-disciplinary professional services firm. We offer our clients advisory and consulting services across a range of financial and accounting functions. Employing over 240 amazing people across six offices, we are grounded in our purpose to provide our clients a clear direction when they need it the most. We are currently on a journey of transformation and growth, harnessing our vast history while enhancing our people and growth strategies, and with that creates many opportunities like this one!

With exciting opportunities for transformative change ahead of us, we are seeking an experienced Data Scientist to join the Economic and Data Analytics team based in Brisbane. This is a unique opportunity to be involved in the development and design of new cutting-edge and internal data analytics services for our innovative forensic and litigation consulting. Our ideal candidate is a creative problem solver and possesses strong technical capabilities in data analytics and programming. This position offers autonomy, competitive pay, and an interesting line up of creative projects.

About the role
• Collaborate closely with the Head of Economics & Data Analytics on a range of strategic, operational, and case projects.
• Help design new cutting edge forensic and analytic services for clients.
• Serve as an internal data consultant on large matters with sophisticated data problems.
• Write robust maintainable software following best practise design and development principals including user/unit testing, versioning, and agile methodologies.
• Dynamically adapt for emerging opportunities including designing and developing new products or services.
• Mentor junior software engineers and data scientists.
• Contribute to building the firm’s technical capabilities and internal training programs in Python.
• Actively monitor developments in new analytics and machine learning techniques.

About you
• Bachelor’s degree in Data Science or Analytics or related field.
• Proven experience in a similar role with practical data analytics or data science experience derived from a Business Services environment.
• Experience in Python and Excel.
• Comprehensive knowledge of Machine learning and natural language processing capabilities are strongly preferred.
• Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
• Excellent critical thinking, a sharp eye for detail and a forward thinker who can adapt, be flexible and deliver high quality results in agile team environment.
• A collaborative person, who has a hands-on approach to problem-solving and is passionate about digital tools, learning and developing new skills. A curious and creative mind.
• Have a desire to make a positive difference in the world, and share the values we believe in.

About the Vincents experience

Core to our growth and success are our people. Some of the ways in which we support our people include:
• Flexible and hybrid working options to support you, your team, and your clients in the most meaningful way
• An additional day of leave a year – VinDay – to use just for you!
• A flat leadership structure that has a genuine open door policy alongside a supportive and friendly work environment
• Ad hoc bring your dog into work days
• A newly created Learning framework to support technical, operational, interpersonal and leadership growth and development on an ongoing basis
• Support with formal accreditations, relevant courses or post graduate study
• Regular learning programs around employee wellbeing alongside an Employee Assistance Program for you and your immediate family
• Annual engagement surveys alongside fortnightly opinion polls to inform, enhance and shape our people initiatives and offerings
• A nominated People Experience Team who drive our firmwide People Engagement Plan
• A competitive employee referral program to enable our people to be rewarded for introducing talent into our business
• A client referral incentive program that rewards our people for the growth of our business.
• Monthly 1-1s with Partners to create deeper connections between our people and their leaders
• An active social committee with a calendar of regular formal and informal events

We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive community for everyone at Vincents. Our shared culture is one of high performance that focuses on a “One Vincents” approach and embodies our firm foundations – shared vision, ambition, and enthusiasm.

To learn more about Vincents visit our website www.vincents.com.au

Vincents is an equal opportunity employer. If you feel you do not meet some of the expectations listed above, but find the role interesting, we would still like to hear from you.

Short term contract with QLD energy provider | located North side of Brisbane
Immediate start into an initial 8 week contract with possible extension

We are looking for a Junior to Mid level Data Analyst who is experienced with Excel!

What you'll be doing:
• Consolidate data sources from multiple systems
• Identify and remove duplicate data
• Identify data that can be archived in line with business rules
• Work with various SMEs to gather missing or incomplete data

How will your ideas contribute to shaping what’s next?

As our Business Analytics Manager, you’ll be a vital part of the award-winning Finance team and responsible for leading, championing, and evolving Aurecon’s internal Data Analytics Centre of Excellence. We will need you to provide data driven insights, problem solving capability and ultimately uncover hidden value and growth opportunities driven by business stakeholders through advanced analytics.

Your Role Will Include
• Lead domain expertise to support achievement of strategy and performance through the delivery of critical analysis and analytics.

How will your future be shaped by us?

Joining Aurecon means you’ll be at the award-winning edge of innovation and sustainability. AFR ranked us Top 5 among sustainability leaders and Top 3 of all innovative companies in professional services. One Consult awarded us an innovative design award. Plus, we were Consult Australia’s large firm of the year.

You really can bring your whole self to work and be confident your voice will be heard. You’ll have a genuine passion for re-imagining problems and continuous learning to help shape the future.

Who is Aurecon?

Aurecon’s strength has always been our people. It’s our people who build our shared purpose and bring ideas to life. So, when you join us, you’ll be joining a community working together to tackle some of the world’s most complex challenges.

Ready to bring ideas to life?

About Us:

At Auto & General (A&G), we provide great products and services to safeguard our customers in their time of need. Our range of general insurance products protects customers on the road, at home and on holiday with various Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents, and Pet products as well as Roadside Assistance.

Our culture of ‘high performance with high integrity’ underpins our values and the way we interact with our customers, the community and each other. We’re excited about the future and we’re always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia’s best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.

The Role

The Pricing Data Scientist will be responsible for undertaking advanced analytics and data science services to support the Pricing Team. This includes developing and implementing best practice predictive models, exploring the use of new or existing data assets, and providing expert support on process improvements. You will also need to provide advice and report on the impact of key Pricing decisions and operational activities on the portfolio.

To be successful in this role, the Pricing Data Scientist should have an appreciation of traditional Pricing approaches and understand the strengths and weaknesses of alternative approaches. They should be able to demonstrate an innovative approach to problem-solving and possess excellent communication skills that target a non-technical audience.

Accountabilities
• Manage the end-to-end development and implementation of a range of predictive models that support the business to make better decisions.
• Review the modelling process including data preparation, modelling, review, implementation and monitoring as well as make recommendations for continuous improvements.
• Support the Actuarial Team’s approach to technical pricing by developing approaches for more efficient processing of external data, classification of assets or use of available information.
• Evaluate and manage complex changes to models and their implications.
• Create test plans, manage and sign-off testing for all business-wide IT changes that impact pricing.

Knowledge And Experience
• 5+ years general insurance industry experience.
• Experience with developing and implementing a range of predictive models for various purposes.
• Proven analytical and problem-solving capability.
• Clear understanding of statistical modelling techniques and, in particular, modern modelling techniques (e.g. machine learning).
• Superior communication skills that include stakeholder management and development of high-quality board papers.
• Familiarity with statistical software packages (e.g. SAS, R, SQL) is advantageous.
• Degree qualified in mathematics, statistics, actuarial studies or similar.

Our Perks
• Location – Our office is conveniently based in Toowong Village shopping centre - a city fringe location with access to retail, restaurants, various parking options and public transport.
• Extra leave - Enjoy additional leave days on us! You’ll receive a paid ‘ME’ day and one paid volunteer leave day annually. Team members can also purchase up to two additional weeks of leave per year.
• Paid parental leave - We support our new parents with paid parental leave and other benefits.

• Development opportunities - We’re championing your development with internal programs and access to a wide range of online courses.
• Employee discounts - You’ll receive discounts on Budget Direct insurance products.

The organisation will drive delivery of world-class pumped hydro assets to provide the long-term storage and reliability needed to power Queensland's clean energy future.

Strong technical skills, including advance experience with BI tools, and experience in dealing both structured and unstructured data sources.

As a senior member of the Information Technology and Innovation team you will use your technical expertise to support and enhance core line of business applications and deliver effective and reliable ITI support and solutions for QLeave and our customers. You will play a critical role in supporting the manager in leading a team, facilitating proactive regular maintenance tasks, incident/problem investigation and resolution, request fulfilment, continuous service improvement activities and various project activities.

Your contribution
• Lead and manage the development of Data and Analytics enterprise architecture across the following domains: Business Information, Application, Technology and Security
• Contribute to the Data and Analytics strategic direction by leading the development and maintenance of appropriate frameworks, roadmaps and future focussed migration plans that detail the target architectures, support the ongoing architectural vision, and align ICT activities with business and product futures
• Define Data and Analytics initiatives to implement strategy, principles, policies and standards in maintaining integrity, security and sustainability of the data environment as it progresses from the current to future state
• Partner with internal units, to ensure the enterprise data architecture is implemented at an operational level and that reporting systems are developed in line with strategic directions and business requirements
• Manage data standards to provide a common approach associated with Queensland Government's Enterprise Architecture framework, policies and standards and influence their implementation across QLeave
• Lead cross-functional data and analytics team with other ICT teams to facilitate the delivery of significant ICT projects across QLeave
• Perform architectural fit review of business cases, implementation strategy and solution specifications for all data and ICT related projects and system enhancements to ensure that solutions chosen/designed/acquired are consistent with the ICT and Data strategy, architectural standards, principles and roadmaps, or alternatively assist in development of exception management plans
• Identify industry trends and directions including information management systems, security and data and analytics management and provide advice on impacts
• Data mining, modelling, and analysis for clients on a weekly, monthly and/or ad hoc basis This also includes producing and interpreting requests for information, data cleaning and imports, and providing specific contact lists and reports to clients and stakeholders contained within the CRM and ERP databases
• Design and develop reports and dashboards using PowerBi or SQL Reporting Services to support service delivery and organisational needs

This position reports to the Manager Information Technology and Innovation and leads a team of three direct reports

What We Are Looking For

For this role, we will consider your:
• Expertise in enterprise data and analytics architecture development and experience in applying data and analytics solutions within an enterprise environment
• Knowledge of QLeave operational environment including data, analytics and ICT technology policies and practices
• Knowledge and application of contemporary Information Technology practices and emerging trends in the development and implementation of information technology solutions
• Analytical, conceptual, and innovative problem-solving skills
• Leadership in a variety of technical, functional, or business project tasks
• High level communication skills with ability to provide advice, consult and negotiate with senior management and a diverse range of stakeholders on complex and strategic issues and build positive relations in an environment of change
• Ability to undertake analysis and draw accurate conclusions based on evidence
• Expertise to achieve outcomes in data, analytics and technical support projects and activities and make effective use of individual and team capabilities
• Understanding of SQL and other web and database development frameworks

There are no mandatory qualifications for this role, however, the following skills and experience would be beneficial:
• ICT and Databases reporting service environment that supports and delivers critical business reporting and analysis with service level targets
• ITIL processes, particularly in incident and problem management, capacity and availability management, change management and release and deployment management
• Agile working environments, prior experience in multi-disciplinary teams and projects

Tertiary or industry qualifications and/or experience in the following technologies will be highly regarded:
• Cloud solution services such as MS Azure / AWS etc
• SQL environments, including SQL queries, stored procedures and high-level database administration
• Reporting and Analytics platforms(PowerBi, Tableau and SQL Reporting Services)

Refer to the attached role description for further details and application instructions

data.job_description:
Could the skills you build here unlock doors anywhere?

At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.

We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.

The opportunity

Due to continued success and growth, an exciting opportunity exists for a Data Analytics Senior Consultant or Manager to join our highly regarded People Advisory Services team.

Our team works as a well-integrated national team, where you’ll have the opportunity to work with Australian-based and multinational clients across the country, therefore offering you the ability to work with large corporates, and a diverse range of industries. In this role, you will have access to training, coaching and support that’s available to help grow your career even further!

This role is open to various locations - Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Adelaide, and Perth.

What’s in it for you?

As our Data Analytics Senior Consultant or Manager - your responsibilities will include:
• Modelling of various Industrial Instrument (including Enterprise Bargaining Agreements, Industry Awards etc.) for wage compliance projects;
• Modelling of superannuation and Pay-As-You-Go Withholding data modelling projects (including the preparation of superannuation guarantee charge statements and voluntary disclosure letters);
• Liaise directly with clients and other regulatory authorities (e.g. Australian Taxation Office, Fair Work Australia etc.) in the delivery of data projects;
• Work with different parts of the business in driving growth in the global mobility data analytics practice;
• Preparing & presenting training seminars to both clients and team members.

What We’re Looking For

Here’s our ‘wish list’ but don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. We’re interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go.
• Degree in Data Analytics/Commerce, or similar;
• Between 1-5 years’ experience in a data analytics discipline (focused towards wage compliance and employment taxes remediation);
• Experience with Alteryx at the intermediate or advanced level;
• Experience with data visualisation software such as Power BI and Tableau;
• Experience with SQL, Python, and other database/coding languages [preferred];
• Ability to lead and mentor junior members of our team;
• Commitment to excellence in client service, with the ability to work both autonomously and as part of a team.

From aged care homes receptionists, dental surgeons, telehealth and admin, to our call centres, data professionals and tech gurus, we're all in it together – 22,000+ people who keep inspiring each other to explore new possibilities, wherever the challenges of the healthcare world take us.
Where are we heading?

We set a global ambition to be the world's most customer-centric healthcare company, and are committed to excellent customer experiences through service, value, and putting our customer at the heart of everything we do.
Care is at our core and will always be a part of how we operate.
More than that, our care puts customers at the heart of everything we do.

We make a genuine effort to see the world through our customers' eyes to make things easy, keep relevant to their needs and showing empathy and understanding.

About the role:

Reporting to the Senior Channel Insights Manager, the Senior Channel Insights Analyst will leverage their natural curiosity and interest in channel processes and customer insights to help develop an understanding of our customer journey.

With a passion for customer advocacy and storytelling through data, they will uncover actionable insights using unstructured and structured data analysis techniques.

This will be achieved through a combination of data collation from available sources, data synthesis using available tools and a comprehensive understanding of operational efficiencies, Bupa's internal processes and the broader Health Insurance (HI) market.

The successful candidate will be instrumental in engaging with key advocacy business partners and Customer and Business Operations (CBO) management to arrive at actionable insights and recommendations.
How will I help?
Key accountabilities of this role include:

Developing insights articulating business impact for critical Quarterly reporting, highlighting causes of customer friction and performance of Internally Escalated / PHIO complaints against market share.

Be the subject-matter-expert and conduit between data and business impact (primarily across the end-to-end complaints journey / process), with the ability to align insights to specific business objectives.
Synthesise unstructured business problems into meaningful recommendations across operational metrics and strategic drivers, including identifying interrelationships and highlighting implications.

Engage and collaborate with stakeholders across CBO and HI to evaluate strategy and share data and insights addressing customer (complaints) experience feedback.

Maintain a suite of PowerBI dashboards to support the regulatory and adhoc cycle of complaints reporting, translating data into easy-to-understand reports and dashboards designed to support business leaders with channel operations.

Continuous improvement of how reports are served, utilising existing technologies and data structures whilst also exploring the art of the possible.

Work closely with business and technical teams to ensure optimal utilisation of available resources and impending technologies – ensure our requirements are proactively addressed and onboarded as we transition to newer data architectures.
Other adhoc work as required for Customer & Business Operations leadership

What do I need?3+ years external / internal business advisory, or management consulting experience
Proven ability to analyse data and present granular or technical data in an effective and reliable manner.
Ability to quickly understand business processes, systems, opportunities and limitations
Manages time effectively to meet competing deadlines and milestones

Works productively in a pressurised environment, keeping emotions under control during difficult situations and balances the demands of work by maintaining a positive outlook at work.
Experience in identifying, quantifying and articulating business improvement opportunities

Excellent written and oral communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence senior leaders with best-in-class data storytelling out of disparate data and information sources.

Ability to build strong advisory relationships with senior stakeholders, as well as seamless engagement and collaboration across the organisational structure.
Capability of working with a high degree of complexity and ambiguity, whilst delivering rapid, accurate and impactful results.

Power to influence based on clearly articulated recommendations and concisely represented data that drives stakeholder expectations to the point of decision-making.
Experience working with contact centre operations or other customer facing environments is preferable
Ability to manoeuvre SAS and SQL databases will be considered as a positive.

Why work at Bupa?We keep our people smiling by helping them improve their lives in and outside of the office.
We're a welcoming lot, no matter who you are or where you've come from. We welcome all talents and backgrounds and embrace our differences, so you can bring your true self to work.
We support our people to be the best version of themselves, physically and mentally.

With a healthy work/life balance, leadership support, reduced private health cover, study leave, volunteering options and a commitment to promoting from within.
Our employees can access wide range of benefits: from our own products (incl.

health insurance discounts) to many other products and services via our partnerships program (like Apple, Samsung, JB Hi-Fi, plus gym and spa discounts to name a few).

We reward our people and celebrate their success, provide initiatives that develop careers and look after our people's health, wellbeing and futures.

Who we are...
Since our beginning, our vision has always been to open up the world for those who want to see.

Queensland Rail's purpose is to provide a customer-focused, safe, reliable, on-time, value for money rail service that benefits the community, supports industry and is integrated with the public transport system. The organisation's vision is connecting communities through a modern, world-class rail service.

We encourage a safe, innovative, and inclusive environment where you can deliver quality service while expanding your career and achieving your professional goals. If you thrive in an environment where motivation, teamwork, and forward thinking are paramount, then a career with Queensland Rail could be the right step for you!

About The Team

The Data and Automation team is a growing function at Queensland Rail with a purpose to provide a greater focus, and uplift capabilities, on using data to help the organisation make better decisions.

We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Principal Analytics Adviser (AS7) to provide expert advice and support in developing an enterprise analytics community, driving data fluency, and enabling self-service reporting and analytics.

About The Role

As the Principal Analytics Adviser, you will be a thought leader who will support and inspire stakeholders to look at data analytics through a different lens, driving a self-service analytics culture. You will achieve this through leading an internal community of practice, demonstrating the art of the possible and providing expert advice on using data to drive business insights.

This is a permanent, fulltime position, based in Brisbane CBD with a starting base salary of $127,221 plus 12.75% superannuation and hybrid work options to support the balance between work and personal commitments.

Please see position description for a full list of responsibilities and key selection criteria: Principal Analytics Adviser

Why join our team?
• Create your own legacy and be a part of a growing team focused on looking at data through a different lens.
• Opportunity to be an influential voice and trusted, strategic adviser to stakeholders and senior leadership.
• Leverage your stakeholder communication skills and data analytics expertise to drive a data insight driven culture within a large, diverse organisation.

The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate the following:
• Excellent data storytelling experience – creating compelling narrative based on complex data and analytics that influence and inform key stakeholders.
• Ability to lead the design and development of data views, reports, dashboards and other data capabilities using modern tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
• Ability to thrive on the challenge of leading people through change and transformative journeys.
• Strong communication, interpersonal, influencing, and negotiation skills including the ability to engage with and inspire a diverse range of stakeholders.
• A relentlessly curious nature and willingness to learn new things.
• Proven analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills.

Lifestyle & Work Benefits at Queensland Rail:
• Four weeks annual leave, as well as other leaves and flexible working opportunities to help balance between work and personal commitments.
• Free travel to-and-from work, as well as access to discounted and/or free rail travel for off-duty travel on the City or long-distance travel networks.

• Access to Fitness Passport – a discounted workplace health and fitness program giving you and your family unparalleled access to a wide range of gyms and pools throughout the state.
• We pride ourselves on our Safety Culture, we ‘work safe’ so that everyone goes ‘home safe’.

Overview

The National Disability Insurance Agency (NDIA) is responsible for the delivery of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS). Since it was established, the NDIA has pursued a vision of optimising social and economic independence and full participation for people with disability. The Data & Analytics Branch supports the Agency by providing high quality data and reporting and translating insights into measurable business performance improvements. It focuses on delivering data and reporting while building data literacy capability across the branch and regions.

Key Responsibilities
• Understand the strategy and the changing needs of the organisation. Capture business requirements and identify underlying business needs.
• Carry out analysis of present approaches and identify opportunities to enhance processes current and target state.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure appropriate stakeholders are included in the development of business requirements.
• Translate subject-matter expert and stakeholder discussion into process flows, procedures and business requirements.
• Identify and document instances where existing business processes may be streamlined or improved or do not meet current or potential future business needs.
• Develop, maintain and validate business requirements with stakeholders.
• Input to the design and implementation of solutions that support the business processes and deliver business insight.
• Liaise with management to coordinate process improvement project activities.
• Workshop facilitation with business stakeholders to map out processes and elicit business requirements.
• Practical Agile Delivery framework experience, developing Initiatives, Epics, User Stories and other documentation.
• Ability to work with the business to identify business process issues, improvement opportunities and potential solutions.
• Ability to gather, analyse and translate business data to meaningful insights.

Every application requires to address selection criteria as part of application submission.

Essential Criteria

1. Able to translate discussion into process flows, requirements and documentation.

2. Able to understand and capture business requirements relating to use / application of data to business problems.

3. Have experience in as is and to be process mapping.

4. Hands on experience with agile product development process for data products as well as developing detailed User Stories and UAC.

5. Intermediate skills with JIRA and Confluence, Visio, Excel, Powerpoint, Word.

6. Showcase good analytical and evaluating skills.

Desirable Criteria

1. Experience as a scrum master.

2. Experience creating wireframes.

3. Data analysis skills.

4. Experience working in data businesses.
